channel.title: Presenting Fedi Foundation: Empowerment for SocialHub community
channel.description:
In follow-up to https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/organizing-for-socialhub-community-empowerment/1529 I have published the first draft of:
## Federated Diversity Foundation
https://fediverse.codeberg.page
Now this website is not a 'foundation' in the sense of a non-profit. It is meant to provide a foundation to both the SocialHub community and the Fediverse technology base. To read more about it, you can visit the following pages:
- [About Fedi Foundation](https://fediverse.codeberg.page/about.html) - [Introducing the Federated Diversity Foundation](https://fediverse.codeberg.page/2021/03/introducing-fedi-foundation/) - [Support the SocialHub Community](https://fediverse.codeberg.page/support/) - [The Fediverse is like Spiral Island](https://fediverse.codeberg.page/2021/04/fediverse-spiral-island-analogy/) (also published [here](https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/socialhub-and-spiral-island-a-fediverse-foundation-analogy/1543))
Some examples of typical content for Fedi Foundation are:
- [The European Commission and the Fediverse](https://fediverse.codeberg.page/2021/05/socialhub-ec-liaison/): A call-to-action in Foster section - [ Exploring the «Community Has No Boundary» paradigm](https://fediverse.codeberg.page/2021/03/community-has-no-boundary/): A pattern document in Ideat section.
The idea is that this site if for and by SocialHub members. Read:
- [How you can publish to Fedi Foundation](https://fediverse.codeberg.page/publish.html)
The website is hosted at [Codeberg](https://join.codeberg.org/), the Gitea instance exclusively for FOSS projects, and the [code repository](https://codeberg.org/fediverse/fedi-foundation) sits in the [Fediverse](https://codeberg.org/fediverse) organization where [SocialCG issue tracker and other repo's](https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/social-cg-issue-trackers/1648) might be move to as well.
### Contribute
Now this is just the first draft of the page. Any contributions are most welcome, and I have already created a bunch of suggestions for improvement on the [Issue Tracker](https://codeberg.org/fediverse/fedi-foundation/issues).
### Discuss
Any feedback you have with regards to this website, and what it can be used for is most, most welcome below :pray: For general discussion on making this community more productive, please comment on the [Empowerment thread](https://socialhub.activitypub.rocks/t/organizing-for-socialhub-community-empowerment/1529).
